intro: Tiglium lanceolatum, commonly known as the lanceleaf tiglium, is a member of the Papaveraceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. Native to regions of Asia, it thrives in temperate climates with well-drained soil. The plant produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in both horticulture and botany.
